;With August 2007, Disney opened a sales center for any timeshare club in this upscale Woodfield Mall, a suburban Chicago retail center. The new mall sales center is called Disney Doorway to Dreams and carries a two bedroom model in the Animal Kingdom suites at Disney World in Holiday to orlando.

;If you've been as a result of Disney World in Florida, you have no doubt seen the signs in the parks and resorts, requesting if you've heard Disney's ; best kept secret ;. Properly, it isn't much of a secret really. That's the come-on for the Disney Vacation Club, that's Disney's timeshare brand. It sounds intriguing, but there's a chance you're a little leery of attending a timeshare presentation in the Disney resorts if you have ever experienced them elsewhere.
;
;Well, let me assure you, you may relax. Even when it comes to selling timeshares, there is a Disney difference in precisely how things are done. So if you would like to see what some of the Disney Vacation Club resorts look like, go ahead and sign up for your tour.
;
;; What you will probably have on a Disney Vacation Club Tour? ;
;
;The first thing that's different about that Disney timeshare presentation is that there is little in the way of enticement. They don't consider it wise to get visitors in the tour by offering them cash or freebies. The most you can expect is a fastpass card that can be used immediately. This allows you to jump the lines on some of the most popular attractions at the parks, consequently it's quite useful if you need to head over to Everest or Soarin' after you finish your tour.
;
;The second big difference is that this Disney presentation isn't very time-consuming. Most timeshare presentations anywhere else will often run 1 1/2 to three hours, depending on the sales representative. Nevertheless with DVC, you may set your own speed. If you need to take a lot of time and have lots of questions, that's okay.
;.

;The Disney Old Key West Resort is a favorite destination for many families for a great fun getaway. ;Back in 1988 I went on a trip to Disney World using my parents and at some time during our vacation people got roped into going on a timeshare presentation at one of the ubiquitous timeshare resorts in the Orlando area. At plenty of time I barely noticed the hard sell and I was supremely disappointed that will my parents didn't read the wonderful potential in timeshares. They decided not to buy and my dreams were smashed.
;
;Properly, I'm a few many years older now and having been through the timeshare presentation ringer repetitions, I feel like something of an champion. So last year, on a trip to help Walt Disney World, I elected to go on a tour of considered one of their properties, Saratoga Springs Resort & Spa. In the morning I scheduled my tour, a Disney Vacation Club guide picked me up at Pop Millennium Resort inside WDW and took me off to help Saratoga Springs.
